main_definition: Energy refers to the capacity or power of a system or object to do work, exert influence, or produce change.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physical energy (the ability to perform physical tasks and activities)
meanings_and_examples.example: She has so much physical energy that she can run a marathon without getting tired.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Energy in the context of physics, the quantitative property which a physical system possesses
meanings_and_examples.example: The kinetic energy of an object depends on its mass and velocity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Mental or emotional vigor (the ability to focus, think clearly, and maintain positive mood)
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite a long day at work, he still had the mental energy to complete his homework.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Vitality and enthusiasm in pursuing goals
meanings_and_examples.example: Her boundless energy helped her accomplish all of her ambitious projects on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The spiritual or philosophical concept that life is an expression of a vital force, often associated with health and well-being
meanings_and_examples.example: Many cultures believe in the flow of energy through our bodies and the importance of balancing it for overall wellness.
